TopicTitle: View the threads I've posted in.

Articles.Content: Is there an easy way to see all the threads I've posted in, so I can quickly check if there've been updates? Besides subscribing to each thread individually (which would be easy to forget to do). I can see my activity, but that doesn't indicate whether the threads have any posts later than mine.
Yes, I made an image about this a while ago:

The 'ONE CLICK' solution: Just check your own profile. It shows your last 30 posts (can be extended to many more) with links to the relevant threads. Unfortunately it does not show if there have been any replies. But neither does Kaspers.

My method does show if there are new posts, don't forget to set the "show results as" option to threads

P.S. If you save your search preferences (step 5) you don't have to repeat steps 1-4 every time, you can just go to the advanced search tab and press search now
I stand corrected. You solution is in fact pretty useful. Got to remember that one.
I use the "Settings" link in the upper right corner by the "Logout" button.
